Provision.Text: Whereas the Governor in Council is of the opinion that the situation in Burma constitutes a grave breach of international peace and security that has resulted or is likely to result in a serious international crisis;

Therefore, Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Foreign Affairs, pursuant to subsections 4(1) to (3) of the Special Economic Measures Acta, hereby makes the annexed Special Economic Measures (Burma) Regulations.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: arms and related material means any type of weapon, ammunition, military vehicle or military or paramilitary equipment, and includes their spare parts. (armes et matériel connexe)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any political subdivision of Myanmar;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the government, and any department of Myanmar or of a political subdivision of Myanmar; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any agency of Myanmar or of a political subdivision of Myanmar. (Birmanie)

Definition.Text: designated person means a person whose name is listed on the schedule in accordance with section 2. (personne designée)
Minister means the Minister of Foreign Affairs. (ministre)

Section.Text: A person whose name is listed in the schedule is a person who is in Burma, or is a national of Burma who does not ordinarily reside in Canada, and in respect of whom the Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a current or former senior official of Burma;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an associate or family member of a person referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an entity owned, held or controlled, directly or indirectly, by a person referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) or acting on behalf of or at the direction of such a person;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an entity owned, held or controlled, directly or indirectly, by Burma, or acting on behalf of or at the direction of Burma; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a senior official of an entity referred to in paragraph (c) or (d).

Section.Text: Subject to section 18, it is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: deal in any property, wherever situated, that is owned, held or controlled by or on behalf of a designated person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: enter into or facilitate any transaction related to a dealing referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: provide any financial or related services in respect of a dealing referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: make available any goods, wherever situated, to a designated person or a person acting on behalf of a designated person; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: provide any financial or related service to or for the benefit of a designated person.

Section.Text: Subject to section 19, it is prohibited for any person in Canada and any Canadian outside Canada to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: export, sell, supply, ship, transport or otherwise deal in arms and related material, wherever situated, destined for Burma or any person in Burma;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: import, purchase, acquire, ship, transport or otherwise deal in arms and related material, wherever situated, that are exported from Burma after December 13, 2007;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: transfer, provide or communicate technical data related to military activities or to the provision, manufacture, maintenance or use of arms and related material to Burma or any person in Burma; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: provide or acquire financial or other services related to military activities or to the provision, manufacture, maintenance or use of arms and related material to, from or for the benefit of or on the direction or order of Burma or any person in Burma.

Section.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada or any Canadian outside Canada to knowingly do anything that causes, facilitates or assists in, or is intended to cause, facilitate or assist in, any activity prohibited by sections 3 and 4.
Each of the following entities must determine on a continuing basis whether it is in possession or control of property owned or controlled by or on behalf of a designated person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: authorized foreign banks, as defined in section 2 of the Bank Act, in respect of their business in Canada or banks to which that Act applies;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cooperative credit societies, savings and credit unions and caisses populaires regulated by a provincial Act and associations regulated by the Cooperative Credit Associations Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: foreign companies, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Insurance Companies Act, in respect of their insurance business in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: companies, provincial companies and societies, as those terms are defined in subsection 2(1) of the Insurance Companies Act;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: fraternal benefit societies regulated by a provincial Act in respect of their insurance activities and insurance companies and other entities engaged in the business of insuring risks that are regulated by a provincial Act;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: companies to which the Trust and Loan Companies Act applies;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: trust companies regulated by a provincial Act;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: loan companies regulated by a provincial Act;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: entities authorized under provincial legislation to engage in the business of dealing in securities, or to provide portfolio management or investment counselling services; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: entities that engage in any activity described in paragraph 5(h) of the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act if the activity involves the opening of an account for a client.

Subsection.Text: Every person in Canada and every Canadian outside Canada shall disclose without delay to the Commissioner of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the existence of property in their possession or control that they have reason to believe is owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by a designated person or by an entity owned or controlled by a designated person; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information about a transaction or proposed transaction in respect of property referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: No proceedings under the Special Economic Measures Act and no civil proceedings lie against a person for a disclosure made in good faith under subsection (1).

Heading.TitleText: Application to No Longer Be a Designated Person

Subsection.Text: A designated person may apply to the Minister in writing to have their name removed from the schedule.
On receipt of an application, the Minister shall decide whether there are reasonable grounds to recommend to the Governor in Council that the applicant’s name be removed from the schedule.
If there has been a material change in circumstances since the last petition was submitted, a person may submit another application under subsection (1).

A person whose name is the same as or similar to the name of a designated person and who claims not to be that person may apply to the Minister in writing for a certificate stating that they are not that designated person.
Within 30 days after receiving the application, the Minister must,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it is established that the applicant is not the designated person, issue the certificate; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is not so established, provide notice to the applicant of the determination.

Section.Text: Section 3 does not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any activity engaged in under an agreement or arrangement between Canada and Burma;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any payment made by or on behalf of a designated person that is due under a contract that the designated person entered into before they became a designated person, provided that the payment is not made to a designated person or to a person acting on behalf of a designated person;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any goods made available, or services provided, to or by any of the following entities for the purpose of safeguarding human life, disaster relief, democratization, stabilization or providing food, medicine, medical supplies or equipment or development assistance:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an international organization with diplomatic status,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a non-governmental organization that has entered into a grant or contribution agreement with the Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade or the Canadian International Development Agency; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any transaction necessary for a Canadian to transfer any existing accounts, funds or investments of a Canadian held with a designated person to a person other than a designated person.

Section.Text: Section 4 does not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: protective clothing and equipment, including flak jackets and military helmets, for the personal use of United Nations personnel, human rights monitors, representatives of the media and humanitarian and development workers and associated personnel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: non-lethal military equipment intended solely for humanitarian, human rights monitoring or protective use, and related technical assistance and training; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: members of the Canadian Forces who are in or travel to Burma in the performance of official duties, including providing security to Canadian diplomatic staff, providing humanitarian assistance, or engaging in other activities authorized by the Chief of the Defence Staff.

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply according to their terms before they are published in the Canada Gazette.
These Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.

Item.Text: Air Bagan (also known among other names as Air Bagan Holdings Pte. Ltd. and Air Bagan Limited)
Hantha Waddy Golf Resort and Myodaw (City) Club Ltd.
Htoo Furniture (also known among other names as Htoo Wood, Htoo Wood Products, Htoo Wood Products Pte. Limited and Htoo Wood-Based Industry)

Myanma Economic Bank (also known among other names as Burma Economic Bank)
Myanma Foreign Trade Bank (also known among other names as Burma Foreign Trade Bank)
Ngwe Pin Le (Silver Sea) Livestock Breeding and Fishery Co.
Rothman of Pall Mall Burma Private Ltd.
Union of Burma Economic Holding Ltd.
Yuzana Company Limited (also known among other names as Yuzana Construction)
Zay Gabar Company (also known among other names as Zaykabar Company)
Cancri (Gems and Jewellery) Company Limited (also known among other names as Phu Sha Star)
Myanma Gems Enterprise (MGE) (also known among other names as Myanmar Gems Enterprise)
Myanma Timber Enterprise (MTE) (also known among other names as Myanmar Timber Enterprise)
Myanma Pearl Enterprise (MPE) (also known among other names as Myanmar Pearl Enterprise)
Ministry of Defence Quartermaster General Office

Myanmar Directorate of Procurement (also known among other names as Directorate of Procurement, Directorate of Defence Procurement and Directorate of Procurement of the Commander-in-Chief of Defence Services (Army))
Aung Thet Mann, born June 19, 1977 (also known among other names as Shwe Mann Ko Ko)
Tin Aung Myint Oo, born May 27, 1950
Chan Nyein, born 1944 (also known among other names as Chang Nyein)
Pye Phyo Tay Za, born January 29, 1987
Mahn Nyein Maung (also known among other names as P’doh (Phado) Man Nyein Maung)
Jeng Phang Naw Taung (also known among other names as Jeng Phang Naw Htaung)
Moung Har (also known among other names as Maung Har and Maung Ha)
Sai Lone Hsaing (also known among other names as Sai Lone Saing and Sai Long Hseng)
Htun Htun Oo, born July 28, 1956 (also known among other names as Tun Tun Oo)

For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply before they are published in the Canada Gazette.
